posts.name: Tetsuya Cox
posts.cooked:
We have a comp this weekend and the issue needs to be fixed by then. Please help.

When the robot sees an april tag, the robot thinks it is on the opposite side of the field. We could be looking at the red algae processor tag, it thinks it is looking at the blue one. In simulation, it works great though. We are using the advantagekit talonfx template with the vision things copied in. Any thoughts or suggestions?

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: What tag are u looking at? How are u updating ur position with vision? Can u share screenshots and code?

posts.name: Tetsuya Cox
posts.cooked:
It swaps what side of the field it is on for every tag. When looking at the blue side, it thinks it is on the red and vise versa.

Code

advantage kit talonfx swerve template. Contribute to Team2977/2025-Robot-Code development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Owen Tharp
posts.cooked:
Hi, I have a few ideas. The most obvious one is to make sure advantage scope has “Blue” as the origin. That is consistent, no matter the alliance. image 2559×1379 223 KB The next thing to try is to look at the tags on the real world, and then the tags on the simulation it thinks it sees. Are they the same? Does it think it sees the wrong tags? Respond to this after youve tried the first. If it doesn’t work, do the second thing?

image 2559×1379 223 KB

image 2559×1379 223 KB

posts.name: Tetsuya Cox
posts.cooked:
Setting the alliance color in advantage scope fixed it. Now I need to redo the auto alignment because it only works for the blue side.

Does anyone know it there is a method or code somewhere that will take blue alliance coordinates and change it into red alliance coordinates?

posts.name: Owen Tharp
posts.cooked:
Yup! The easiest solution is to just subtract by the field width. I have two files here that you could find useful:

As well as a code for mirroring any point horizontally:

posts.name: Owen Tharp
posts.cooked: I believe the first code also flips the y, which isn’t always wanted. If that is the case and you just want a pose to flip sides on the field and nothing else, this code is a much simpler class:

posts.name: Amicus1
posts.cooked: Unlike the last two years, this field is rotated, not mirrored.

posts.name: Owen Tharp
posts.cooked: No problem! If anything else comes up, I’d be happy to help.

suggested_topics.title: Can no longer find Limelight after working fine previous day
suggested_topics.fancy_title: Can no longer find Limelight after working fine previous day
suggested_topics.excerpt: I had it wired Incorrectly, I had a PoE cable running from the radio not to it, so once I changed that and just used a normal ethernet cable from Aux 1 to the limelight that solved the problem
